alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 12:23PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1221 PM EST, rain and snowmelt is causing flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding is occurring along Duck Creek, with the gauge at Macksburg currently reporting minor flood stage. Between 13 and 15 feet Broad Street starts to flood near the creek. Homes on the left bank start to flood. Campground next to gage floods. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
